. It's name IZENAH in breton.
It's situated in "Golfe du Morbihan" (Bay of Morbihan), region Morbihan (south of Brittany).

Length 7 km, width 3,5 km, 610 islander

It's the bigger island of the bay, 
pretty, full of flowers, old stone and amazing landscape,
it deserv a walk...

To get the ferry, you need to go in Port-Blanc in city of Baden (15km of Vannes)

From Vannes, you should take the bus line orange (LARMOR-BADEN - VANNES), near train station, 
but there is few bus by day, so you can also hitchhike: take the bus in Place Republique, line 4 in direction "Mairie Arradon" and stop in station "Le Petit Molac"..you are on the road of Baden! 
Schedule of bus on =
In Port-Blanc, you should take the ferry of izenah-croisieres, from 7h to 19h30, there is a ferry each half an hour, 4euros double way.
(1,8 km one way): discover  church Saint-Michel, and from the "Pointe Trech", beautiful view on Arradon and Island of Arz.
(2,5 km): discover chapel, fountain, and from the "Pointe of Brouel", a view on Island of Arz.

(4,4 km): discover celtic megalith, view of the bay, thatched cottage, grove, 
and at 500 meter of Penhap, on the "Pointe de Nioul", a large view on peninsula of Rhuys.
